newsitem.title: FRANCE: PARIS BOURSE RECOVERS FROM EARLIER LOWS.
newsitem.headline: PARIS BOURSE RECOVERS FROM EARLIER LOWS.

text.p: French shares came back from their lows after falling by over two percent on the back of reports the French government wants to discuss the European stability pact with its national assembly and that Finance Minister Dominique Strauss-Kahn said he needed more than a week to discuss the stability pact. European ministers could not agree on budget pact in Luxembourg on Monday. Amsterdam summit scheduled for June 16 and 17.
Bank of France leaves rates unchanged.
* CAC-40 index down 50.49 points, or 1.86 percent, at 2,668.76 at 1121 GMT
* CAC-40 June futures 2,652 vs 2,700 at Fridays close.
* CAC-40 volume 3.75 billion francs, total volume 4.98 billion.
